description: Rada Miskovic receives decrypted copies of Halden's personal confessionals from independent archivists, describing his intentional sabotage of the BCI to empower citizens. Rada debates whether to broadcast the material, aware of the risk to fragile public order.

Rada Miskovic, after careful deliberation, publicly broadcasts Halden's confessionals via state media, revealing his intent to end algorithmic rule and urging collective accountability. The revelations spread rapidly, stirring citywide outrage and hope.

Districts organize spontaneous assemblies and public rituals in response to Halden's revelations. Citizens openly recount BCI-era losses, forging new bonds and making pledges for transparency and community decision-making.
Community-elected district representatives formalize a Federation Charter, rejecting secret surveillance and abolishing algorithmic decision-making in favor of transparent, collective governance.
Stenograd inaugurates annual public audits and memory rituals based on Halden’s final appeals, anchoring the city’s new civic foundation in transparency and shared remembrance.
